Package org.tquadrat.foundation.config.ap

Interface PropertySpec

All Known Subinterfaces:
SpecialPropertySpec
All Known Implementing Classes:
CharsetProperty, ClockProperty, LocaleProperty, MessagePrefixProperty, ProcessIdProperty, PropertySpecImpl, RandomProperty, ResourceBundleProperty, SessionKeyProperty, SpecialPropertySpecBase, TimeZoneProperty
@ClassVersion(sourceVersion="$Id: PropertySpec.java 1010 2022-02-05 19:28:36Z tquadrat $") @API(status=MAINTAINED, since="0.1.0") public interface PropertySpec
The specification for a property of a configuration bean.
Author:
Thomas Thrien (thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org)
Version:
$Id: PropertySpec.java 1010 2022-02-05 19:28:36Z tquadrat $
Since:
0.1.0

  • Method Details

    • createAddMethod

      Optional<MethodSpec> createAddMethod(CodeBuilder codeBuilder)
      Creates the specification of the 'add' method for this property.
      Parameters:
      codeBuilder - The factory for the code generation.
      Returns:
      An instance of Optional that holds the method specification.

    • createConstructorFragment

      Optional<CodeBlock> createConstructorFragment(CodeBuilder codeBuilder)
      Creates a code block that is a fragment for the constructor of the new configuration bean and that initialises this property.
      Parameters:
      codeBuilder - The factory for the code generation.
      Returns:
      An instance of Optional that holds the code block.

    • createField

      Optional<FieldSpec> createField(CodeBuilder codeBuilder)
      Creates the field specification for this property.
      Parameters:
      codeBuilder - The factory for the code generation.
      Returns:
      An instance of Optional that holds the field specification.

    • createGetter

      Optional<MethodSpec> createGetter(CodeBuilder codeBuilder)
      Creates the specification of the getter for this property.
      Parameters:
      codeBuilder - The factory for the code generation.
      Returns:
      An instance of Optional that holds the method specification.

    • createSetter

      Optional<MethodSpec> createSetter(CodeBuilder codeBuilder)
      Creates the specification of the setter for this property.
      Parameters:
      codeBuilder - The factory for the code generation.
      Returns:
      An instance of Optional that holds the method specification.

    • getAddMethodArgumentName

      Name getAddMethodArgumentName()
      Returns the name of the 'add' method's argument.
      Returns:
      The argument name; is probable null when getAddMethodName() returns Optional.empty().

    • getAddMethodName

      Optional<Name> getAddMethodName()
      Returns the name of the 'add' method for this property.
      Returns:
      An instance of Optional that holds the name of the add method.

    • getCLIArgumentIndex

      OptionalInt getCLIArgumentIndex()

      Returns the index for an argument on the command line.

      The return value will be empty if the property is not a CLI argument.

      Returns:
      An instance of OptionalInt that holds the index.
      See Also:
      • Argument.index()

    • getCLIFormat

      Optional<String> getCLIFormat()
      Returns the special CLI format.
      Returns:
      An instance of Optional that holds the format.
      See Also:
      • Argument.format()
      • Option.format()

    • getCLIMetaVar

      Optional<String> getCLIMetaVar()
      Returns the name of the CLI meta variable for this property.
      Returns:
      An instance of Optional that holds the name of the meta variable.
      See Also:
      • Argument.metaVar()
      • Option.metaVar()

    • getCLIOptionNames

      Optional<List<String>> getCLIOptionNames()

      Returns the CLI option names. The mandatory first name in the list is the primary name, the optional others are the aliases.

      The return value will be empty if the property is not a CLI option.

      Returns:
      An instance of Optional that holds the option names.
      See Also:
      • Option.name()
      • Option.aliases()

    • getCLIUsage

      Optional<String> getCLIUsage()
      Returns the CLI usage text for this property. This text will not be localised.
      Returns:
      An instance of Optional that holds the usage text.
      See Also:
      • Argument.usage()
      • Option.usage()

    • getCLIUsageKey

      Optional<String> getCLIUsageKey()
      Returns the CLI usage key for this property. This key is used to retrieve a localised usage text.
      Returns:
      An instance of Optional that holds the usage key.
      See Also:
      • Argument.usageKey()
      • Option.usageKey()

    • getCLIValueHandlerClass

      Optional<TypeName> getCLIValueHandlerClass()
      Returns the CLI value handler class for this property.
      Returns:
      An instance of Optional that holds the TypeName for the handler class.
      See Also:
      • Argument.handler()
      • Option.handler()

    • getCollectionKind

      CollectionKind getCollectionKind()
      Returns the kind of collection for this property.
      Returns:
      The collection kind.

    • getEnvironmentDefaultValue

      Optional<String> getEnvironmentDefaultValue()

      Returns the default value for an environment variable or a system property. This is used to initialise this property when it has the annotation @EnvironmentVariable or @EnvironmentVariable, but no value is provided.

      A default value is mandatory when the annotated property has a primitive type.

      Returns:
      An instance of Optional that holds the default value.

    • getEnvironmentVariableName

      Optional<String> getEnvironmentVariableName()
      Returns the name of the environment variable that is used to initialise this property.
      Returns:
      An instance of Optional that holds the environment variable name.
      See Also:
      • EnvironmentVariable

    • getFieldName

      default String getFieldName()
      Returns the name of the field for the property.
      Returns:
      The field name.

    • getGetterBuilder

      Optional<MethodSpec.Builder> getGetterBuilder()
      Returns a builder for the getter for this property.
      Returns:
      An instance of Optional that holds the builder.

    • getGetterMethodName

      Optional<Name> getGetterMethodName()
      Returns the name of the getter method name. If there is no name for the method, it will not be generated.
      Returns:
      An instance of Optional that holds the name of the getter method.

    • getGetterReturnType

      TypeName getGetterReturnType()
      Returns the return type of the getter. This is not necessarily the same as the property type.
      Returns:
      The getter's return type.

    • getINIComment

      Optional<String> getINIComment()
      Returns the comment for this property in the INI file.
      Returns:
      An instance of Optional that holds the comment.

    • getINIGroup

      Optional<String> getINIGroup()
      Returns the group for this property in the INI file.
      Returns:
      An instance of Optional that holds the group name.

    • getINIKey

      Optional<String> getINIKey()
      Returns the key for this property in the INI file.
      Returns:
      An instance of Optional that holds the key.

    • getPrefsAccessorClass

      Optional<TypeName> getPrefsAccessorClass()

      Returns the Preferences accessor class.

      This is used when this property is linked to a preference, but also to initialise it from a SYSTEM preference.

      Returns:
      An instance of Optional that holds the TypeName for the accessor class.
      See Also:
      • PreferencesBeanSpec
      • Preference.accessor()
      • SystemPreference.accessor()

    • getPrefsKey

      Optional<String> getPrefsKey()

      Returns the Preferences key for this property.

      This is used when this property is linked to a preference, but also to initialise it from a SYSTEM preference. In first case, the name is defaulted to the property name, while it is mandatory otherwise.

      Returns:
      An instance of Optional that holds the preferences key for this property.
      See Also:
      • PreferencesBeanSpec
      • Preference.key()
      • SystemPreference.key()

    • getPropertyName

      String getPropertyName()
      Returns the name of the configuration property.
      Returns:
      The name.

    • getPropertyType

      TypeName getPropertyType()
      Returns the property type.
      Returns:
      The property type.

    • getSetterArgumentName

      Name getSetterArgumentName()
      Returns the name of the setter's argument.
      Returns:
      The argument name; is probably null when getSetterMethodName() returns Optional.empty().

    • getSetterBuilder

      Optional<MethodSpec.Builder> getSetterBuilder()
      Returns a builder for the setter for this property.
      Returns:
      An instance of Optional that holds the builder.

    • getSetterMethodName

      Optional<Name> getSetterMethodName()
      Returns the name of the setter method name. If there is no name for the method, it will not be generated.
      Returns:
      An instance of Optional that holds the name of the setter method.

    • getSpecialPropertyType

      Optional<SpecialPropertyType> getSpecialPropertyType()
      Return the 'speciality' type for this property.
      Returns:
      An instance of Optional that holds the speciality type.

    • getStringConverterClass

      Optional<TypeName> getStringConverterClass()
      Returns the class that implements the String converter for the type of this property.
      Returns:
      An instance of Optional that holds the implementation class for StringConverter.

    • getSystemPrefsPath

      Optional<String> getSystemPrefsPath()
      Returns the path to the SYSTEM Preferences node that holds the data for the initialisation of this property.
      Returns:
      An instance of Optional that holds the path.
      See Also:
      • SystemPreference.path()

    • getSystemPropertyName

      Optional<String> getSystemPropertyName()
      Returns the name of the system property that is used to initialise this property.
      Returns:
      An instance of Optional that holds the system property name.
      See Also:
      • SystemProperty

    • hasFlag

      boolean hasFlag(PropertySpec.PropertyFlag flag)
      Checks whether the given flag is set for this property.
      Parameters:
      flag - The flag to test for.
      Returns:
      true if the flag is set, false otherwise.

    • isCollection

      default boolean isCollection()
      Checks whether this property is a collection of some kind.
      Returns:
      true if this property is a collection, false otherwise.

    • isEnum

      boolean isEnum()
      Returns the flag that indicates whether the property is an enum type.
      Returns:
      true if the property type is an enum, false otherwise.

    • isOnCLI

      default boolean isOnCLI()
      Checks whether this property is exposed to the CLI. This means that it has either the flag PropertySpec.PropertyFlag.PROPERTY_IS_ARGUMENT or the PropertySpec.PropertyFlag.PROPERTY_IS_OPTION set to it.
      Returns:
      true if the property is exposed to the CLI, false otherwise.

    • merge

      PropertySpec merge()

      'Merges' the attributes from a special property with the attributes retrieved from the configuration bean specification and returns a new instance of PropertySpec. The original instance remains unchanged.

      If the property is not a special property (the flag PropertySpec.PropertyFlag.PROPERTY_IS_SPECIAL is not set), this instance will be returned.

      Returns:
      The effective property specification.
